meanings.definition: To crown or invest with a crown.
meanings.sent1: The king will coronate the queen during the royal ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The royal family will coronate the new monarch with a majestic crown.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten tried to coronate its toy mouse with a tiny crown.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to coronate the mountain peaks with a golden glow.
meanings.sent5: The grand coronation ceremony will coronate the chosen ruler with a symbol of power.

meanings.definition: To form the top or summit of.
meanings.sent1: The snow-capped mountain will coronate the landscape with its majestic peak.
meanings.sent2: The tall tree will coronate the forest canopy, standing above the rest.
meanings.sent3: The cherry on top will coronate the delicious ice cream sundae.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse will coronate the cliff, guiding ships safely through the night.
meanings.sent5: The bright star will coronate the night sky, shining brightly among the others.
